channel.title: Posts on Teng Jiang
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Teng Jiang

item.title: Why Sebastian?
item.description: ##Unfinished On social occasions, I go by Sebastian. I get a lot of “Oh, and it is …” Of course, that’s not my given name. I chose it somehow arbitrarily when I was taking French in high school (You know how it went since I never bring that up). But I gave myself several very good reasons to stick to it until today. First: It’s LOOOOOOONG! Sebastian is a refined choice among today’s boy names, standing out with his posh feel and substantial size.

item.title: Why Sebastian?
item.description: On social occasions, I go by Sebastian, a name I gave myself somehow arbitrarily when I was taking French in high school. I get a lot of “Oh, and it is …” Of course, that’s not my given name. My given name is “Teng”(腾), which should be pronounced as [tʰəŋ], not [tʰɛn]. One of the reasons I chose Sebastian over Teng is the latter’s pronunciation: I genuinely do not want people to get confused.

item.title: Detour to Quant
item.description: I just think it would be nice to archive something I’ve done so that it would be lost. I tutor prospective students enthusiastic about Financial Engineering at Peking University. Notes here. Deep-Deterministic-Policy-Gradient-based Dynamic Hedging Strategy: Repo under construction.
